Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Remove Typed[Package/Part/etc]" (#1401) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This was helpful for a while, but things have been refactored enough we
don't need a specific layer for this anymore. This will make it simpler
to break the Excel/Word/PowerPoint packages out to their own assemblies
as well.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Need to be able to add relationships, etc without using Package" (#1400) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
How do I do this now that `Package` is `Obsolete`?
```cs
var newId = (uint)(spreadsheetDocument.Package.GetRelationships().Count() + 1);
var rId   = "relId" + newId;

...

spreadsheetDocument.Package.CreateRelationship(uri,
                                               TargetMode.Internal,
                                               "http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/officeDocument/2006/relationships/worksheet",
                                               rId);
```

It would be nice if the `Obsolete` message pointed us in the right direction. I'm rolling back to `2.19.0` for now.

_Originally posted by @michaelcsikos in https://github.com/dotnet/Open-XML-SDK/issues/1295#issuecomment-1506581653_
